meanings.definition: Things that cause irritation or frustration.
meanings.sent1: Loud noises are one of the annoyances in the city.
meanings.sent2: Traffic jams can be major annoyances during rush hour.
meanings.sent3: The constant buzzing of a fly can turn into one of the annoyances of daily life.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending construction outside my window became an annoyance that I couldn't ignore.
meanings.sent5: The annoyances of a slow internet connection can test anyone's patience.

meanings.definition: Feelings of displeasure or discomfort caused by something bothersome.
meanings.sent1: Her annoyances with the broken air conditioner were evident from her frown.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't hide his annoyances with the long wait at the doctor's office.
meanings.sent3: Despite her annoyances with the rainy weather, she tried to stay positive.
meanings.sent4: The annoyances of a sore throat made it difficult for him to speak.
meanings.sent5: His annoyances with the noisy neighbors kept him up at night.

meanings.definition: Actions or behaviors that provoke anger or impatience.
meanings.sent1: His constant interruptions were becoming annoyances during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The loud chewing noises were annoyances that grated on her nerves.
meanings.sent3: The playful annoyances of her younger brother always made her smile.
meanings.sent4: The annoyances of waiting in long lines tested everyone's patience.
meanings.sent5: The annoyances of a dripping faucet can drive anyone crazy.
